medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain started several weeks ago, located in the epigastrium. The pain acutely worsened before the patient sought medical attention, became severe, and was intolerable, exacerbated by oral intake including water. Symptoms included nausea and dark-colored urine with night sweats reported several times in the last few weeks and worsening over the weekend.
medical_history.past_medical_history: IPMN in pancreatic tail, diabetes mellitus type II, chronic kidney disease stage III, vocal cord paralysis, obstructive sleep apnea, hypertension, obesity, laryngeal stenosis, nephrolithiasis, sialolithiasis, history of chronic sinus and ear infections. Surgical history includes vocal cord implant, spinal fusions, separated sternum repair, cholecystectomy, right shoulder rotator cuff repair, and appendectomy.
